intro: Habenaria baoulensis, commonly known as the Baoulé orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to West Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant typically produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in a raceme, often with a distinct lip. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
